abstract: In January, John Browne, chief executive of BP, the British energy company, announced that he would step down in July, more than a year earlier than expected. But he didn’t make it that long: Mr. Browne quit Tuesday as head of the company after a judge lifted a ban on newspaper reports that alleged that he had spent company funds on a Canadian man with whom he had a relationship.
